Linus and Luke reflect on one of the most surprising lessons they’ve learned from the community: people often come to tech content to escape the world, not engage with it. They unpack the tension between covering tech policy issues like right to repair or import tariffs and the growing pressure to avoid “politics” altogether. Can tech content truly stay apolitical?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t_JfQEr9PQ0

title: What piece of feedback changed LMG the most?

You paid for a perpetual license, now Broadcom wants you to uninstall it. Linus and Luke react to VMware users receiving cease and desist letters for using software they legally purchased, following Broadcom’s acquisition of the company. What does “perpetual” even mean anymore? And is this legal, or just another aggressive push to force subscriptions?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t_JfQEr9PQ0

title: Lifetime licenses are becoming meaningless
